text: Klára Peslarová (born 23 November 1996) is a Czech ice hockey player for Modo Hockey and the Czech national team.2019 IIHF Women's World Championship roster == Career == After two years with SDE, Peslarová signed with the men's HC Poruba team in the Czech Republic for the 2017-18 season. After one year with the team, she returned to Sweden to sign for Modo.https://sportbloggare.com/a-brit-on-thin-ice/sdhl-interview-klara- peslarova-modohttps://hockeysverige.se/2019/09/09/de-ar-ligans-basta-malvakter === International === She was named Best Goaltender at the 2014 IIHF U18 Women's World Champhionships, as the Czech Republic won a bronze medal for the second time in the country's history.https://thehockeywriters.com/klara- peslarova-team-czech-republic-goalie/ She participated at the 2016 IIHF Women's World Championship, as well as the 2017 and 2019 World Championships.2016 World Championship rosterhttps://www.theicegarden.com/2019/4/12/18307863/2019-womens-world- championship-group-b-goaltenders-were-amazing-harss-fujimoto-baldin-peslarova ==References== ==External links== * Category:1996 births Category:Living people Category:Czech women's ice hockey goaltenders Category:Sportspeople from Ostrava Category:Czech expatriate ice hockey people Category:Czech expatriate sportspeople in Russia Category:Czech expatriate sportspeople in Sweden Category:SDE Hockey players
title: Klára Peslarová
